revised_title: Account of a Machine for Raising Water at Oulton, Cheshire in 1772
tldr: The author describes a water-raising machine executed in 1772 at Oulton, Cheshire, which effectively supplied water to a brewhouse and other offices. The machine used the momentum of water to force air out of a valve, allowing the water to flow. However, the air pressure eventually caused the valve to burst.
